messages.title: My plan for the Royal Town
messages.content: Andrew Mitchell shares his plan including regeneration of the town centre, saving the police station, fighting for the royal park, getting brexit done, standing up to developers, and holding the city council to commitments for more devolution.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Andrew has been working tirelessly to campaign for our Town Centre. He holds regular discussions with the Town Mayor, BCC, and the owners of the Gracechurch Centre and other properties at the heart of our Royal Town.
Andrew is working relentlessly with the town council to campaign against its closure.
Andrew firmly believes that our park should be free for the residents of Royal Town.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Make Brexit work for the Royal Town
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Andrew strongly believes in leaving the European Union. Andrew supports Johnson's deal so we can get Brexit done.

Andrew stood with activists to save our beautiful greenfield site, unfortunately, the building will go ahead. However, Andrew's number one priority is to not impact adversely on the existing character of our Royal Town.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Hold the City Council to the commitment they made for more devolution.
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Andrew is constantly pushing for further devolution so that more control is secured and not from Birmingham.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Jeremy Corbyn, Nicola Sturgeon, Jo Swinson
mentions.tacticalSituation: A Lib Dem-Conservative coalition is not an option. So your local vote will decide. Another hung parliament - or a Conservative majority.

issues.brexitEurope: Make Brexit work for the Royal Town. Leave the European Union.
issues.education: More funding for every pupil in every school
issues.environment: End our contribution to global warming by 2050
issues.governance: Hold the City Council to the commitment they made for more devolution.
